title: 112_s1411
content: The Act may be cited as the "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" and establishes a website for Congressionally mandated reports. The "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" requires the Public Printer to establish a website within a year for the public to access electronic copies of all congressionally mandated reports. The website must include citations to the statutes or conference reports requiring the reports, along with open format electronic copies of the reports. The "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" mandates the establishment of a public website for accessing electronic copies of congressionally mandated reports. The website must provide open format reports that can be easily searched by title, agency, publication date, congressional committee, subject tags, and report identification numbers. The "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" requires a public website to provide electronic copies of reports mandated by Congress. The website must allow easy search and access to reports within 30 days of submission, with a means for bulk download. The "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" mandates a public website for easy access to congressionally mandated reports. The website must allow free access without any fees or registration requirements. It should also have the capability to be upgraded as needed to fulfill the Act's purposes. The "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" mandates a public website for easy access to congressionally mandated reports, with no fees or registration requirements. The website must be upgradable to fulfill the Act's purposes. Federal agencies have responsibilities outlined in Section 3. The "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" requires Federal agencies to publish mandated reports on a public website in an open, machine-readable format. Additional information must be submitted to the Public Printer. Guidance for implementation will be issued within eight months. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget, in consultation with the Public Printer, will issue guidance to agencies on implementing the "Access to Congressionally Mandated Reports Act" within eight months of its enactment. SEC. 4. RELATIONSHIP TO REQUIREMENTS TO SUBMIT REPORTS TO CONGRESS. Federal agencies are required to publish unredacted reports on a designated website and notify Congress of their availability. Reports can only be altered or removed with congressional committee approval. SEC. 5. RELATIONSHIP TO FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT. This Act does not require the disclosure of information exempt from public disclosure under section 552 of title 5, United States Code. If any information in a congressionally mandated report cannot be publicly released, the Federal agency must redact it from the report submitted for publication on the designated website. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines "congressionally mandated report" as a report required by Congress or its committees, and "Federal agency" as defined in section 102 of title 40, excluding the Government Accountability Office. SEC. 7. IMPLEMENTATION. The Act must be implemented within one year of enactment and applies to reports submitted to Congress one year after enactment.
